thread.title: Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. reports on 2017 Year End Results with Revenue of $3,870,165

author: cnbc.com
title: Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. reports on 2017 Year End Results with Revenue of $3,870,165
text:
NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION TO U.S. WIRE SERVICES OR FOR DISTRIBUTION INTO THE UNITED STATES
TORONTO, April 27, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. (TSX-V:GUF) an established company focused on the acquisition, management and development of anchored shopping centres in Western Canada, reports a 3.5% decrease in revenues to $3,870,165 in the year ended 2017 from $4,011,189 at same period last year.
Details of the twelve and three months financial results for fiscal 2017 and 2016 under International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) as summarized below are also available at www.sedar.com or at the company’s website www.gpequities.com .
Year Ended Three Months Ended (Audited) (Unaudited) December 31, December 31, 2017 2016 2017 2016 Revenue $ 3,870,165 $ 4,011,189 $ 945,750 $ 888,369 Net Income (Loss) before fair value adjustment and income taxes $ 653,258 $ 633,262 $ 442,086 $ 236,819 Net Income (Loss) per common share before fair value adjustment and income taxes – basic and diluted $ 0.03 $ 0.03 $ 0.03 $ 0.01 Net Income (Loss) and Comprehensive Income (Loss) $ (168,588) $ (1,739,809) $ (386,646) $ (2,023,866) Net Income (Loss) and Comprehensive Income (Loss) per common share – basic $ (0.01) $ (0.08) $ (0.01) $ (0.09) Net Income (Loss) and Comprehensive Income (Loss) per common share – diluted $ (0.01) $ (0.08) $ (0.01) $ (0.09) Weighted average number of common shares outstanding – basic and diluted 21,290,685 21,290,685 21,290,685 21,290,685 About Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp.
Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. was incorporated under the laws of the Province of Alberta on April 8, 1998 and thereafter completed a public offering of common shares by prospectus dated June 26, 1998 (TSX-V:GUF).
The Company acquires, manages and develops anchored shopping malls in rural centres in Western Canada, in particular Alberta. Gulf & Pacific targets smaller, but rapidly growing hub communities that have hospital, high school, police station and retail/service infrastructure. Management has consistently reinvested cash flow to improve and grow its portfolio of income properties.
Gulf & Pacific Equities Corp. currently owns three, well-located retail assets located in Three Hills, St. Paul, and Cold Lake Alberta.
